entry.title: [SecureDLs] Use secure downloads in DownloadFramePolicy tests
entry.content:
This CL updates dwonload frame policy tests to use HTTPS-based downloads

instead of HTTP. This is in preparation for an upcoming change that will

cause warnings to be shown on insecure warnings (and causes these tests

to fail).



As part of this change, this CL updates the test to use non-public

hostnames instead of registrable hostnames foo[.]com and bar[.]com. This

allows the HTTPS server to offer a valid certificate to Chrome.



Bug: 1352598

entry.title: [A11y] Fix DCHECK related to missing parent
entry.content:
This fixes a DCHECK caused by an image's child being detached, and

that child object remaining in the cache but not attached to anything.

In the a11y tree, images can adopt children from elsewhere in the DOM via the usemap attribute, which results a lot of special cases in the engine.



Fixed: 1468593

entry.title: Add crash key to log if the destroyed RFH is outermost frame
entry.content:
The current crash reports show that the NavigationRequest is not being

reset before the destruction of the RFH when the BFCache eviction

happens (rather than the FrameTree destruction).



When evicting a BFCache entry, we reset the NavigationRequest if the

RFH's outermost main frame is the same RFH that was restored from the

NavigationRequest owned by the RFH's FrameTreeNode. We are curious to

know if this unexpected case only happens when the RFH is not the

outermost main frame. This CL adds an additional crash key to record this information.



Bug: 1468984

Change-Id: I513b12bd513ab0b3986c08953e4d85f0dcbc7e36

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4776362

entry.title: [Privacy Hub] Fix crash when privacy hub isn't enabled
entry.content:
When privacy hub isn't enabled it's still possible to mute the

microphone from quick settings.

Muting the microphone from QS also shows the notificatio which is now

handled by the sensor agnostic privacy hub logic.



The privacy hub logic will attempt to retrieve a delegate which

provides the names of apps for the specific sensor.



This delegate was only created when privacy hub is enabled leading to

the crash. This CL removes the early return while setting up the

delegate thus preventing the crash when the microphone is disabled and

an app tries to access it.



Bug: b:295923023

Change-Id: I0c194aca2a6a39ade3a925b39109f783ec4f7be8

entry.title: Complete the definition of Emulated Forced Colors Color Provider
entry.content:
This CL is the first step of moving the forced colors state to the

color pipeline.



This change does not affect the current behavior of the forced colors

mode. The main change is to add color definitions for system colors to

the Emulated Forced Colors Color Provider. The provider currently only

has color definitions for scrollbars, this change adds color

definitions for system colors. In the subsequent CLs, we will

implement the logic to switch between the Emulated Forced Colors Color

Provider and the default Forced Colors Color Provider based on the

forced colors state and apply the system colors to web content and

other controls accordingly.



Bug: 1430181

entry.title: [omnibox][categorical] Merges suggestion subtypes from lower-ranking dupes
entry.content:
This ensures searchboxstats reports the categorical subtypes when those

suggestions are deduped with higher relevance verbatim and/or local

history matches so the backend continues to decorate categorical

suggestions.



Note this does not change the AutocompleteMatch type - thus there is

still one catch: When a SEARCH_WHAT_YOU_TYPED match is selected the

`assisted_query_info` field in the ChromeSearchboxStats proto is not

reported. This is to prevent trivial suggestions from getting credit

for being selected. In local testing, if the user input matches the

query, the decorated categorical suggestion stops being suggested. This

is likely because the backend relies on the `assisted_query_info` field

to discern the selected suggestion subtypes.



I believe not making a special case for reporting `assisted_query_info`

for categorical suggestions is the right thing to do. After all it is

hard to say the decoration added any value as the user typed the entire

query. If any special case needs to be made, that ought to be in the

backend triggering logic.



Fixed: 1472335

Change-Id: Ia35bf2dd56b99f5c92f08e6b69b8827e56f1ae90

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4775365

Code-Coverage: findit-for-me@appspot.gserviceaccount.com

Reviewed-by: Justin Donnelly

entry.title: [A11y] Adds chrome.accessibilityServicePrivate
entry.content:
Adds the chrome.accessibilityServicePrivate extension API which

will be used by Accessibility features in ChromeOS which need to

request actions and receive events from a browser process via a helper

extension installed in that browser process. Adds the first API

function, speakSelectedText, behind a feature flag for the new API.



When Select to Speak in Ash is enabled AND the flag is on, the

extension will add the context menu that users can use to start

speech at currently selected text.



This does not yet plumb through context menu clicks to Ash, that

will happen in follow-up change crrev.com/c/4711673.



Bug: 1459275,b/271633121

entry.title: Use the viewBox from a view spec when computing SVG natural dimensions
entry.content:
Factor out a SVGSVGElement::CurrentViewBox() function that returns the

viewBox from a view spec - if one is active - or the value from the

element itself otherwise. Use this function when retrieving the natural

dimensions in LayoutSVGRoot::UnscaledIntrinsicSizingInfo.



Doesn't fix the referenced issue, but is a necessary step in the right

direction.

entry.title: Cleanup and simplify more unused VRB UI elements
entry.content:
Performs a second pass at removing UI elements that have been unused

since the VRB removal earlier this year. This CL is a little more of a

mix of straightforward removals and a few removals where all the

callers/creators were setting the same values and so those classes

have had those attributes converted to be part of their core behavior

rather than a settable attribute (Text specifically). Some of these

removals are only possible due to the previous removal of the "Exit VR"

button during the timeout screen. In doing this pass, some items that

seem outdated do still seem to be used by GVR, so may not be able to be

removed until we can fully remove that code. Future work will try to

isolate those behind the `enable_gvr_services` build configuration.



There will likely be more parts; the split of this CL is somewhat

arbitrary as I'm trying to not overwhelm reviewers and ideally would

like code search to catch up a bit to help ease the process of

identifying classes and methods that are unused; especially as this

cleanup effort transitions more from obvious deletions to things that

may exist but are only ever used in one way, or were only used by

classes that have since been deleted.

entry.title: Keep PrefetchResponseReader until SinglePrefetch dtor
entry.content:
Before this CL, `PrefetchResponseReader` can be deleted

after `CreateRequestHandlerInternal()`.



This CL makes the `PrefetchResponseReader` always alive and

`SinglePrefetch::response_reader_` always non-null

until `SinglePrefetch` dtor,

to keep the PrefetchContainer servable again until that.



this CL makes `PrefetchResponseReader` RefCounted,

because both `SinglePrefetch` and navigation requests should

keep `PrefetchResponseReader` alive,

and to fix an issue similar to crbug.com/1463000.



This CL adds an exhaustive unit test `PrefetchContainerLifetimeTest`

as this CL adds corner cases around lifetime & ownership.



Bug: 1449360, 1463000

subframes navigating top frames to external protocols (common in ad

frames).

not visible, which is the case when a new window is opened and then

entry.content:
Speculative fix for a problem where the Close Tab and Close Window menu

item shortcuts are not updated correctly. Previously, the code held

references to these menu items, gathered at launch time. If the AppKit

replaces these items at any time, these references will no longer be

valid (which could cause the problem). With this cl, we look up these

menu items dynamically anytime we need them.

entry.title: [Auto-disable Accessibility] Point ChromeAccessibilityUtil to AccessibilityState
entry.content:
This CL continues the work to consolidate all accessibility state

management in Clank to a single source, AccessibilityState.java.



With this CL we point the ChromeAccessibilityUtil to use

AccessibilityState so that under-the-hood all parts of the Clank

code-base are running off the same accessibility state engine.

We do not remove the ChromeAccessibilityUtil to keep the code

change small, and after some general usage and manual testing

we will follow-up with a series of CLs to completely remove

the ChromeAccessibilityUtil class.



The implementation in AccessibilityState matches the previous

existing impl of ChromeAccessibilityUtil, i.e. checking if

accessibility is enabled is equivalent to asking: "is there a

service that uses touch exploration enabled, OR, is there a

service that requested to perform gestures enabled." This is

subtly different than what AccessibilityState will consider as

"enabled" in the future, since it provides more granularity in

state information. As we move to AccessibilityState, we will

audit usages and see if a more granular check can be applied on

a case-by-case basis.



AX-Relnotes: N/A

entry.title: ash: Fix an issue with all-desk windows
entry.content:
When switching desks, all-desk windows are moved from the previously

active desk, to the new active desk. After having been moved, they are

stacked according to some rules.



There's a persistent issue that sometimes happens when stacking these

windows in that some all-desk windows are not actually on the active

desk. There's a hypothesis that this is due to a window being promoted

to all-desk while it isn't on the active desk.



This CL checks if a window that is being promoted to all-desk is on the

active desk. If it is not, it is first moved there. Additionally, we'll

dump a stack trace to see how we got there.



BUG=b:295371112



Change-Id: Id3993ea078b28745ee57af8104dff01e4f2eb971

entry.title: Add timeout message for extensions api tests
entry.content:
RunExtensionTest is waiting for response from JS testing code, when

timeout, it might not indicate a browser_tests error. The current

primary error message for the test suite is only said:



result_catcher.cc(25): Failed

RunLoop::Run() timed out. Timeout set at ProxyRunTestOnMainThreadLoop@content/public/test/browser_test_base.cc:833.



which could be waiting for anything on the JS side. and LUCI Analysis is

clustering them as the same issue. e.g. https://crbug.com/1394367



This CL added the extension path to the error message to differentiate

the error.



Change-Id: I1ce7365d8cf497d7bf4d20af7b5d216ea33abdb2

entry.title: iwa: Refactor the IWA install manager to use a result callback
entry.content:
The InstallIsolatedWebAppFromCommandLineManager class was architected

assuming that the caller only needed to send the result message directly

from the class via LOG_*.



This is changing as we plan to support installing the IWA via the

chrome://web-app-internals internal webui page. In the new system, we

want to return the result (success or failure) back across a mojo pipe

for the page to display within a div.



In order to prepare for returning the result async, update all of the

conventions in this class that use ReportInstallationResult directly to

instead use a result callback which in the command-line and test cases

will continue to be just a wrapper around ReportInstallationResult.



Bug: 1472373, b/264423148

entry.title: Scheduling APIs: Don't create a TaskSignal for yield
entry.content:
If yield() is given a plain AbortSignal and priority, it creates a

composite TaskSignal for each continuation. Instead of combining the

abort and priority sources into a (potentially new) TaskSignal, keep

them separate, using the abort source for aborting and priority source

(provided TaskSignal or cached fixed priority signal) for picking the

task queue.



Note: We still potentially create a signal for each postTask task for

propagation, which we'll consider changing in a follow-up.



Bug: 1471528

Change-Id: Ieaec3fe8116861cdbecf2c747390d75c145796b5

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4740221

Reviewed-by: Nate Chapin

Commit-Queue: Scott Haseley

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1183315}

entry.title: Reland "[Auto-disable Accessibility] Deprecate the old isTouchExplorationEnabled method"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 8093792e931a2fb10d09d74b630356addca2925d



Original change's description:

> [Auto-disable Accessibility] Deprecate the old isTouchExplorationEnabled method

>

> This CL continues the work of consolidating accessibility state to a

> single source in Clank.

>

> With this CL we update all callers of isTouchExplorationEnabled to the

> equivalent method in AccessibilityState. For some methods we instead

> migrate to isScreenReaderEnabled, since it more accurately represents

> the condition that was meant to be checked. We keep the original method

> in place but add a @Deprecated annotation to discourage use.

>

entry.title: Use computed size when resolving the thickness of underlines.
entry.content:
According to the spec [1], the thickness of text decoration lines

specified as a percentage value should be calculated using 1em of

the used font. This means the CSS font-size-adjust CSS property

and size-adjust descriptor should not affect the underline thickness.



[1] https://drafts.csswg.org/css-text-decor-4/#valdef-text-decoration-thickness-percentage

entry.title: Support <geometry-box> values on clip-path basic shapes
entry.content:
This patch adds support for values on clip-path

s (https://drafts.fxtf.org/css-masking/#the-clip-path).

https://pr.gg/clip-path-geometry-box-examples.html contains some

basic examples that are now supported.



The large implementation pieces in this patch are:

* Instead of parsing a single value for clip-path shapes, we now parse

shapes into a list which can contain a shape or a geometry box. With

the feature disabled, we still produce a list, but do not let

geometry-box values in.

* `ClipPathClipper::LocalReferenceBox` now supports geometry-box with

three implementations: LayoutBoxes, SVG children, and inlines. SVG

foreign object requires special handling due to its unique

coordinate space (e.g., zoomed), and new WPT tests have been added

covering this. There were no tests of geometry-box on inlines, and

tests have been added covering this as well.

* TODOs have been added for a followup that will implement standalone

on clip-path (e.g., clip-path: margin-box).

* One subtest in wpt/css/css-masking/parsing/clip-path-valid.html has

been updated to accept the serialization order of the grammar (this

matches firefox): circle(7% at 8% 9%) border-box.



Chrome status:

https://chromestatus.com/feature/5068167415595008



Bug: 694218

Change-Id: I687c928c7d881535d6f25022aab0cb4acba498b2

entry.title: media/gpu/v4l2:V4L2StatefulVD: Implement H264 decoder logic
entry.content:
This CL implements the logic for H264 decoding by having |h264_parser_|

parse the stream. The parsing logic is in VerifyDecoderBufferHasOnlyWholeNALUs()

which allows the decoder to take a DecoderBuffer with a whole NALU.



There are H264 test vectors that pass the

ChromeStackDecoderVerification test while there are limitations in the

current implementations that fail in several places.

... rather than waiting for GC to remove the algorithm from the signal's

entry.title: [dPWA] Crash fix for MLInstallationTracker
entry.content:
This CL fixes the crash for MLInstallOperationTracker by not

rerunning the pipeline if a ML reporter is already connected to

the current_install_ operation tracker.



This seems to be happening when:

1. A MLInstallOperationTracker instance is created.

2. MLInstallabilityPromotion runs the pipeline, reaches the

classification stage, assigns the reporter to the tracker.

3. Pipeline restarts, MLInstallOperationTracker still alive.

4. MLInstallabilityPromotion reaches the point again, tries to

set the reporter again, hits the CHECK.



Bug: 1472629, b/295911258

Change-Id: I50bf769e7bdbf2dbe0ebfd26535ce2a50cb43920

entry.content:
Do not expand the latest notification if it is grouped, as this caused a bug that made it seem that the notifications were animating in due to

the grouped notification collapsing right after being expanded (group

notifications are always collapsed when initialized).



Also some refactoring:

- Replace `is_latest` var by modifying the notification expanded state

at the end of the for loop

- Make variable names more descriptive (view -> message_view_container)

- Remove `CollapseAllNotifications` function that only collapsed notifs.

that were not manually changed and have code inline so its easier to

follow

entry.title: [Mac Immersive Fullscreen] Reland of prevent spaces switch on child window removal
entry.content:
Removing a child window from a fullscreen window that isn't on the

active space causes a switch to that space. This cl adds machinery to

defer child window removals until a window becomes active, exits

fullscreen, or closes.



This is a reland of https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4642775 . The major change is

handling child window "reordering," which consists of calls to remove

and add back child windows (triggering a Space switch). Addressing

this also fixed the main reason for the previous revert, which was black

stripes appearing at top of the fullscreen window.



Bug: 1454606,1469105,1469240



Test: out/Default/interactive_ui_tests \

--gtest_filter=ImmersiveModeControllerMacInteractiveTest.DeferChildWindowRemoval



Include-Ci-Only-Tests: true

entry.title: Update Accessibility Feature Tile behavior
entry.content:
This CL adds a toggled state for the accessibility feature

tile. Whenever an accessibility feature is enabled the tile

is now toggled and a sub label is displayed to signify the first

enabled feature along with a count to show how many features

are enabled.



This CL also adds a `name_resource_id` field for the

AccessibilityControllerImpl::Feature class so that we can

entry.title: [uia] Added check for if anchor is null
entry.content:
The CL that I landed which introduced the functions relevant for this CL

Made assumptions that the current position's anchor node would not be

null, but the checks in place for this did not make it so we would

not exit early if this was the case, and so it could still continue

with the anchor being null which led to crashes.



This CL makes it so we return early if the anchor node is null,

and removes some unnecessary checks given that the new one has been

added.

entry.title: Rewrite pointer-id determination for gesture events.
entry.content:
This CL consilodates all pointer-id tracker code into

PointerEventFactory. The original tracker in PEF was not designed for

ids in async events (like clicks) fired after pointer-ids becomes

inactive through pointerup/pointercancel events. Later on additional

trackers were added in GestureManager for delayed-access to removed

pointer-ids, but it still needed to cover the case that the renderer

may not have seen any pointerevent until the delayed click.



This CL adds in PEF a list of recently removed pointers and removes

related states in GestureManager. It also allows PEF to reserve a

pointer-id for unseen events.



Bug: 1264930
